description.narrative: Displaced families either sheltered in public buildings or living in overcrowded homes of extended family or friends are deeply traumatized after 3 years of war and encounter daily constraints in accessing basic goods and services. With the increase of violence, and extreme deterioration of the economic and humanitarian situation, Local residents and IDPs in and around Damascus are more and more dependent on external support. It is clear from repeatedly reported information that access to food is the primary concern and the main constraint is lack of income. With decreasing or no purchasing power, households are resorting to extreme coping strategies in order to meet basic needs. The low rainfall of the previous season and resulting reduction in agricultural production may exacerbate this. JRS will serve 5,000 daily meals in the field-kitchen of Sahnaya, to respond to the food security needs of 4,250 IDPs and 750 affected members of the local community in Rural Damascus. The project aims at saving lives by providing a nutritious meal 6 days a week. Special attention is paid to children, and pregnant and lactating women.As the kitchen is closed for 1 day a week, families are receiving ‘dry’ and tinned food during the meal distribution on day 6. Overall objective: To ensure that IDPs and host communities in Rural Damascus satisfy their most urgent nutritional needs. Specific objective: 5,000 war affected persons in Rural Damascus (IDP or host communities) satisfied their most urgent nutritional needs by getting access to hot meals
